title: One Piece - Fishman Island Arc (Episodes 539-553) Review
author: Hogan Reviews
description: Comprehensive review of the Fishman Island Arc episodes 539-553, describing Fisher Tiger's story as 'a well written tragedy and a good look at racism'.

title: 540-541: 'A Hero Who Freed the Slaves! An Adventurer Tiger!' and 'Kizaru Appears! a Trap to Catch Tiger!'
author: Never Watched One Piece
description: Detailed blog analysis describing episodes 540-541 as 'top quality, world-building scenes' and 'the kind of flashbacks you want in a series'. Highlights themes including 'class-based oppression, slavery, racism and racial segregation'.

title: Racism In One Piece: If Malcom X & MLK Could Breathe Underwater
author: ParaDoxy
description: Analysis comparing Fisher Tiger to Malcolm X and Queen Otohime to MLK, examining how One Piece portrays different approaches to fighting racism and oppression.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains thematic spoilers about racism storyline

title: Fishman Island: One Piece's Savvy Portrayal of Racism
author: The Celestial Sanctum
description: Analysis of how the Fishman Island arc, including Fisher Tiger and Otohime's stories, provides a nuanced portrayal of racism and discrimination.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains spoilers for Fishman Island flashback arc

title: One Piece: Addressing Real-World Issues Such as Racism and Slavery
author: CBR
description: Article examining how One Piece addresses real-world issues of racism and slavery through storylines like Fisher Tiger's liberation of slaves.
